projects.title: Custom Folders Image Generation
projects.description: A custom application that automatically generates organized folder structures with image previews, streamlining file management and organization workflows.

projects.title: HOA Website
projects.description: Created a homeowners association website using modern web technologies, featuring tools and information for residents on a platform that is easy for the HOA to manage.

projects.title: Project Memories
projects.description: With snapchats new paywall I decided to make a way to easily download all your snapchat memories and view them in a memories view like experience! This project is still under development!

updates.title: Became President of VCU's Information Systems Organization
updates.description: Taking over the position of President for the VCU Information Systems Organization starting in the Spring 2026 semester. I am very excited to share my ideas and leadership with an organization I care deeply about. I was previously webmaster in the Fall 2025 semester.

updates.title: Won third place in the 2025 VCU AI in Business Competition
updates.description: Developed a business plan with my team proposing AI implementation for a manufacturing company.

updates.title: Student Panelist on AI in Education
updates.description: I served as a student panelist at the Every Learner Everywhere convening in Richmond, VA, discussing the student experience with digital learning in the age of AI. As an Information Systems major with a minor in Practical Artificial Intelligence at VCU, I shared how AI has changed my studying, research, and daily workflow, and why clear ethical boundaries matter in the classroom.

updates.title: Innovation Catalyst Micro Internship Completed
updates.description: I finished my recent Innovation Catalyst micro internship where I conducted structured interviews with students to understand how they use digital payment methods and where those systems fall short. The insights I gathered will support the Virginia Department of Accounts as they explore improvements to statewide e payment experiences. This experience strengthened my user research skills and my ability to turn raw feedback into actionable insights.

blog.title: Welcome to My Blog
blog.content: This is my first blog post where I'll be sharing my thoughts on recent events, technology trends, and insights from my journey as an Information Systems student.
blog.excerpt: Welcome to my blog! Here I'll share thoughts on technology, recent events, and my journey in Information Systems.
blog.author: Wyatt Anderson

blog.title: Metro UI
blog.excerpt: Windows phone emulator I forked and added onto
blog.content:
I love emulators, especially when it comes to re-living old operating systems. Recently, I started looking for a Windows Phone emulator and came across one by 4rnv that emulates a Windows Phone experience directly in a web browser. It has some really cool features, so I decided to fork the project and add a bunch of my own features just to experiment and learn.

Check it out at the link below, and be sure to check out the original repository as well.
blog.author: Wyatt Anderson

personalInfo.name: Wyatt Anderson
personalInfo.title: Information Systems Student & Tech Enthusiast
aboutText: I'm an Information Systems undergraduate at Virginia Commonwealth University with a minor in Practical AI, driven by a passion for technology, innovation, and hands-on learning.
I'm from the Washington, D.C. area and live in Richmond Virginia during school. I love to work on projects that peak my interest & are useful to people.
